Entity: The National Alliance to End Homelessness
Description by AI: The National Alliance to End Homelessness is a national nonprofit organization committed to preventing and ending homelessness in the United States. The organization works with federal, state, and local partners to develop and implement policies and best practices to address the root causes of homelessness. The National Alliance to End Homelessness also provides technical assistance and training to communities across the country to help them more effectively address homelessness.

Transitional housing is a type of housing designed to help people who are in the process of transitioning from one living situation to another. Transitional housing can provide a temporary place to live for people who are homeless, fleeing domestic violence, or transitioning out of foster care or other forms of institutional care. Transitional housing can also be used to help people who are struggling with addiction or mental health issues.

The U.S. Interagency Council on Homelessness (USICH) is a federal government organization that was created in 1987 to coordinate the federal government's response to homelessness. The council is made up of representatives from 19 federal agencies that work on programs and policies related to homelessness. The council's mission is to "prevent and end homelessness in the United States."
